image.altText: A mass of protesters carrying signs that say "guilty".

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has been found guilty on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records in his New York criminal trial relating to "hush money" payments paid to adult film star Stormy Daniels. Follow live.

title.children: Trump lashes out after being found guilty on 34 counts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump's attorney says they will keep fighting and 'it's not over'
PM Anthony Albanese reacts to Trump verdict
When will Donald Trump be sentenced?

image.altText: Donald Trump in court

props.synopsis: The jury in Donald Trump's "hush money" trial finds the former president guilty of 34 counts of falsifying business records, a felony that could result in prison time.

title.children: Donald Trump becomes first US president to be found guilty of a crime

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him.

props.synopsis: An international syndicate that uses a Pokémon avatar claims to be behind a major Ticketmaster cyber attack, and it's not the first time the group has taken aim at high-profile companies with vast customer databases.

title.children: The 'remarkably devious' ShinyHunters hackers allegedly behind the Ticketmaster data leak

image.altText: A close up photo of a bettong with a pink nose bundled in navy blue fabric.

props.synopsis: The number of brush-tailed and burrowing bettongs surveyed at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary in central Australia has nearly doubled since last year.

title.children: Once extinct in central Australia, this 'little kangaroo-looking' marsupial is now thriving in a remote desert safe haven

image.altText: A row of white electric vehicles lined up in a showroom.

props.synopsis: The rapid rise of Chinese electric vehicles has been met with resistance in the US and Europe. So why are Australians buying them at record levels?

title.children: Why Chinese-made cars are becoming so common on Australia's roads

image.altText: A close-up of a little girl sitting on a hospital bed with her arm bandaged and clutching a panda bear.

props.synopsis: Ten-year-old Lama was dressed and her bag packed to escape Gaza after seven months of war when Israel invaded Rafah and closed the only crossing out of the enclave.

title.children: Ten-year-old Lama was moments away from fleeing Rafah. Then tanks arrived on her doorstep

image.altText: Chrystal blue waters and swimmers.

props.synopsis: They're home to subtropical beaches that city slickers dream of, but an emerging trend shows some regional movers are moving away again from Australia's most popular regional cities after arrival.

title.children: Growing pains turn movers away from popular coastal cities as 'the dream is not always what they presume'

image.altText: Andrew Giles looking slightly confused in Question Time

props.synopsis: It was a direction meant to bring a "common sense" approach to appeals by non-citizen criminals who have their visas cancelled. Instead, "direction 99" caused a furore after it was used to reinstate the visa of a man who now stands accused of murder. Here's what it's about.

title.children: What is the immigration 'direction 99' causing Andrew Giles and the government so much trouble?

image.altText: A dark sky with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A 5,000-kilometre-long cloud band travelling west to east is expected to drench parts of the country over the coming days. Following a second rainband, a separate weather system is threatening to bring heavy rain from NSW to Tasmania from Saturday to Thursday.

title.children: Three weather systems combine for an ongoing Australia-wide soaking

image.altText: A woman with short, curly ,red hair in a floral dress posing behind an orange tiled bar.

props.synopsis: Self-professed “over-achiever” Olivia Franklin shares what she has learnt after being forced to move on from failed dream, and the more than $100,000 worth of debt that has come with it.

title.children: Olivia's small business failed and she's finding ways to deal with the financial impact

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: Today marks the deadline for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann to lodge an appeal against a ruling in the Federal Court that found on the balance of probabilities he raped Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's deadline to appeal findings of failed defamation case runs out today

image.altText: A man's hand holding a bottle of beer.

props.synopsis: Advocates and MPs say the government must stand up to the alcohol lobby if it's serious about stopping violence against women and children.

title.children: Should late home delivery of alcohol be banned to help bring down rates of violence against women?

image.altText: Bunnings store sign

props.synopsis: The local share market is trading higher on Friday after recording losses earlier in the week, while Brookfield is set to become Australia's largest renewable energy operator after agreeing to buy Neoen for $10 billion. Follow live.

title.children: Bunnings remains Australia's most-trusted brand, ASX rises after three straight days of losses

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What happens to US Federal Reserve boss if Trump becomes President?
Qantas and Perth Airport strike multi-billion deal to create new terminal
ASX up in the opening minutes of trade as gold price boosts miners

image.altText: GreenieCyber3

props.synopsis: A senior Australian official has travelled to Taiwan for high-level talks on countering Chinese cyber threats, amid growing pushback from Beijing against any diplomatic contact with the democratic island.

title.children: Senior Australian security official travels to Taiwan amid diplomatic tensions with China

image.altText: CCTV vision of Yahya Sinwar disappearing into a tunnel.

props.synopsis: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar disappeared down a tunnel and has not been heard from since, but this Israeli journalist says he has been in contact.

title.children: From deep beneath Gaza, the Hamas mastermind of October 7 is apparently in contact with an Israeli journalist

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie standing and speaking into a microphone at a lecturn. He holds up one clenched hand

props.synopsis: When we consider the desirability of federal hate speech legislation, we quickly run into the freedom-of-speech conundrum. But a line in the sand would be useful.

title.children: Government's pursuit of a hate speech law could take it down another cul-de-sac

image.altText: Dr Johnson is looking directly at the camera, wearing glasses, a grey suit and patterned tie

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's geology agency is "jumping out of his skin" at the massive investment to map out the nation's critical minerals and water supplies.

title.children: Hanging a clothesline from a helicopter to map the nation's most precious resources

image.altText: A graphic of a yellow sun on a pink background, behind the photos of two young girls and a boy, and vote box.

props.synopsis: As Australia marks its first Reconciliation Week since voting no to an Indigenous Voice to Parliament, young First Nations people and advocates for change say they are still hopeful the country can heal, but that truth-telling will be key.

title.children: What does reconciliation look like in a no-vote world? Young Indigenous people share their hopes for the future

image.altText: Alex de Minaur, wearing blue tennis gear, clenches his fist after a point at the French Open.

props.synopsis: Australian number one Alex de Minaur reaches the third round at Roland Garros for the first time in eight attempts, before Thanasi Kokkinakis bounces back from two sets down to win a five-set marathon.

title.children: De Minaur breaks French Open hoodoo and Kokkinakis mounts miracle comeback on another rainy day

image.altText: An American Airlines jet lands in front of a 'welcome' sign at LaGuardia airport in New York

props.synopsis: Three of the eight black men allegedly ejected from the flight in January accused the airline of "racial profiling" all black passengers onboard.

title.children: US airline sued for allegedly ejecting all black passengers before take-off

image.altText: An aerial shot of a waterway and a small town.

props.synopsis: Vincent Edward Down was last seen in 1969. A coroner has now handed down findings into his death.

title.children: 'I may have washed out the back of the ute': Murder suspect made late-night admission at police officer's home

image.altText: Fatima Payman stands with her arms crossed inside her Parliament House office

props.synopsis: A Labor senator who accused Israel of carrying out genocide on the Palestinian people has resigned from her position on two parliamentary foreign affairs committees.

title.children: Labor senator resigns from foreign affairs committees after genocide comments

image.altText: Giants Netball player Jodi-Ann Ward raises her arms.

props.synopsis: Giants goal defender and Jamaica's Sunshine Girl Jodi-Ann Ward chases gold at the next World Cup after making a memorable transition to Australia's Super Netball in 2019.

title.children: Jamaican players embracing 'crazy' Super Netball have World Cup gold in their sights

image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

props.synopsis: A newly released report shows Australia's icebreaker, the RSV Nuyina, is facing a $100 million cost blowout by 2030 due to rising crew, fuel and maintenance costs.

title.children: Crewing and maintenance costs, fuel consumption leaves troubled vessel facing $100m cost blowout

image.altText: A giant blue monster puppet stands next to a man in a dark office

props.synopsis: From a whimsical 80s New York cop thriller to Beyonce's country journey, here's everything that you should catch this month.

title.children: Benedict Cumberbatch is plagued by a seven-foot puppet in this gritty new cop thriller

image.altText: David Anderson answers questions while facing a senate hearing

props.synopsis: The ABC's managing director David Anderson has defended high-profile journalist Laura Tingle over comments she made about Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, telling a parliamentary committee though her remarks lacked context, her reporting for the public broadcaster "stands the test of scrutiny".

title.children: ABC boss defends Laura Tingle's 'misstep' over Dutton comments, backs her journalism

image.altText: Chad Warner of the Sydney Swas takes a mark high above a pack of Western Bulldogs during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The 2024 AFL season is one of the closest in recent memory, but the Sydney Swans have separated themselves as we reach the halfway mark of the season. Here's what they're doing better than everyone else.

title.children: How the Swans have climbed above a congested AFL pack in 2024

image.altText: Zach Merrett and Jade Gresham celebrate

props.synopsis: After last season ended with a whimper for Essendon, a host of the club's leaders embarked on an off-season trip to a world-renowned training facility in the United States. The result has been one of its best starts to a season in the last two decades. Here's a look at what the Bombers did in Arizona.

title.children: 'They were maniacs': Inside the US training camp that vaulted Essendon up the ladder

image.altText: Lana Flack dressed in her racing gear.

props.synopsis: The 12-year-old is one of six young women who were hand-picked from around the world to participate in a driver development program looking to improve equality in motorsport.

title.children: A 12yo girl from Brisbane has been hand-picked for a driver program searching for F1's first female champion

image.altText: A computer with hacking software on the screen and someone's hands typing on the keyboard

props.synopsis: Around 2 million Australians may be caught up in the Ticketmaster hack. Here's what you should be looking out for and how to protect yourself from hackers and scammers.

title.children: How do I know if I've been hacked? Here's what experts say to look out for in light of the Ticketmaster breach

image.altText: A young woman can be seen in a crowd of people as they march down a city street

props.synopsis: The new government in New Zealand handed down its first full budget and details of its long-promised tax cuts, but as that happened thousands of people rallied for a national day of protest against its policies.

title.children: 'I believe we're on the edge of a revolution': While the NZ government delivered its budget, protests were sweeping the nation

image.altText: Brett Button wearing a suit and tie and glasses walks in to court

props.synopsis: The Newcastle District Court has been told sentencing proceedings for a bus driver over a fatal crash in the New South Wales Hunter Valley will be drawn out given the gravity of the case.

title.children: Court told sentencing proceedings for Hunter Valley bus crash driver Brett Button will be lengthy

image.altText: A close up of orange letters that read "BHP" affixed to the side of a building.

props.synopsis: Mining giant BHP might have pulled out at the 11th hour in its takeover ambitions for rival Anglo American, but make no mistake — it's a question of when, not if, the Big Australian will come knocking again.

title.children: BHP might have walked away from Anglo American for now, but this isn't the end of the road

image.altText: Brian Wilson, Mike Love, Dennis Wilson, Carl Wilson, David Marks from band The Beach Boys pose with a surfboard

props.synopsis: The Beach Boys races through part of the band's complex history without properly interrogating the band's many biggest challenges.

title.children: There was a whole lot of darkness behind the scenes of The Beach Boys. It's all in this new doco
